title: fennic
author: fennic
content: Hi guys I know I am not of expert but I have found that some users are unable to find Segwit addresses cause this is new in Bitcoin and after some research I have found that there are some methods where you can get Segwit  (  bech32 ) address. These are listed below. 1) For PC users, Install Electrum wallet and that follo simple procedure and you will find your Wallet address that will be Segwit and usually initiated with the becl address code. 2) Use Binance cause Binance supports Segwit deposit address and that's so simple and Binance helped me very much and that is simplest method to get Your BTC address.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: fennic on December 10, 2022, 06:27:28 PM1) For PC users, Install Electrum wallet and that follo simple procedure and you will find your Wallet address that will be Segwit and usually initiated with the becl address code. Usually initiated with becl?That's wrong. Native segwit (bech32) addresses always start with bc1 and nested segwit addresses always start with 3.Also, electrum is available for android phones as well. Quote from: fennic on December 10, 2022, 06:27:28 PM2) Use Binance cause Binance supports Segwit deposit address and that's so simple and Binance helped me very much and that is simplest method to get Your BTC address.  Note that Segwit soft fork was implemented more than 5 years ago and most of exchanges support segwit addresses.

comments.author: SquirrelJulietGarden
comments.body: Bitcoin Taproot (Bech32m - bc1p) adoptionBitcoin has many Segwit types, Bech32 Native Segwit and Bech32m (Taproot) are one of them. You can follow the Bech32 adoption page from Bitcoin wiki to check what wallets, exchanges support Bech32, Bech32m addresses.Nowadays, support for Native Segwit address type (Bech32) is very popular and with multiple choices, you should choose non custodial wallets to store your bitcoins and make your transactions from it with bech32 addresses to save transaction fee.

comments.author: Crypto Library
comments.body: First of all I wanna mention that "what is Segwit wallet?" for those who were beginners and reading this thread.Quote from: trustwalletcommunity link=https://community.trustwallet.com/t/trust-wallet-is-segwit-compatible/923Segregated Witness (SegWit) is a protocol upgrade developed in 2015. The protocol upgrade brought up a number of benefits, such as improved transaction speed and block capacity. In addition, SegWit solved the so-called transaction malleability bug.As of June 2020, Bech32 349 is supported in many popular wallets and is the preferred address scheme. Visit this thread to know about more details about segwit wallet : https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5402207.msg60336158#msg60336158You can also visit this thread for know why you should use it which was created by 1miau Why people should be using SegWit addressesI would like to say OP that what wallet you are using that is Centralize wallet I would suggest you that if you want to hold your funds for long  then you can avoid Centralize wallet and use Decentralize wallet  And there are many trusted decentralized wallet like you already mention  Electrum wallet you can also use trust wallet, and I think you will get more fund security in decentralized wallet than Binance where your funds are centrally controlled and  in decentralised wallet the withdrawal fee  lower than Binance. But you can use centralized exchanger based on your needs, segwit wallet supports few more famous exchangers one of them is kucoin. But even there you have to pay high withdrawal fee.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Because OP mentioned electrum as one of the wallet to choose from for creating a segwit address, I'm guessing he knows some other wallet to get a segwit address for as well.OP needs to know that all centralized exchanges now have segwit addresses as deposit addresses for users. But of course it's not a secure storage address because you'll never have the key. Remember that those are not your keys, they are not your bitcoin, so if someone wants to have a segwit address as long term storage then they need to have a proper and trusted wallet.
